original: PEHRSSON, Erik Gustaf, Direktör, Bergsingenjör, Sandviken, f Hälsingb 20/3 90 av lantbr N P o Alma Gudmundsson, gm (2) Mai Areschoug. Studex Hbg 08, ex KTH (metallurgi o hyttkonst) 12. Ing SKF Gbg 13—16, lab.ch Atlas verkstad Sthlm 16—17, disp AB Atlas Diesels avd Atlas 18—26, vkst dir AB C E Johansson Etuna 26—31, tekn dir Sandvikens jvksAB 31—38, v. vkst dir o tekn ch där sed. 38. Styr.led Sandv jvksAB, Seljansö AB, AB Lidkps vikingsågar, Skogens kolAB, Krångede AB, Lanforsens kraftAB, Norbergs, Kolnirigsbergs, Bispbergs, Tuoluvaara, Stripa sarnt Bastkärns gruvAB, AB Holmgruvan, AB Järnbr.förnödenh, Järnbr.fbr, AB Sveaexp, AB C E Johansson, AB Nymans verkstad, AB Elba, Förvaltn.AB Hermes. Jvgsflmsuppl i Jvgsstyr. RNO, RVO.
translated: PEHRSSON, Erik Gustaf, Director, Mining Engineer, Sandviken, born in Hälsingb on March 20, 1890, the son of farmer N P and Alma Gudmundsson. Married (2) to Mai Areschoug. Studied at Hbg in 1908, graduated from KTH (metallurgy and smelting art) in 1912. Engineer at SKF in Gothenburg from 1913 to 1916, laboratory technician at Atlas Verkstad in Stockholm from 1916 to 1917, sales representative at AB Atlas Diesels department Atlas from 1918 to 1926. Vice Managing Director at AB C E Johansson in Etuna from 1926 to 1931, Technical Director at Sandvikens Järnverks AB from 1931 to 1938, and Vice Managing Director and Technical Manager there since 1938. Board member of Sandvikens Järnverks AB, Seljansö AB, AB Lidköps vikingsågar, Skogens kolAB, Krångede AB, Lanforsens kraftAB, Norbergs, Kolvämdesbergs, Bispbergs, Tuoluvaara, Stripa and Bastkärns gruvAB, AB Holmgruvan, AB Järnbr.förnödenh, Järnbr.fbr, AB Sveaexp, AB C E Johansson, AB Nymans verkstad, AB Elba, Förvaltn.AB Hermes. Member of the Railway Board. Recipient of the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav and the Royal Swedish Order of Vasa.

structured.name: Erik Gustaf Pehrsson

worksFor.name: Sandvikens Järnverks AB
worksFor.jobTitle: Vice Managing Director and Technical Manager

award.name: Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav

structured.description: Erik Gustaf Pehrsson was a Swedish director and mining engineer. He was born on March 20, 1890, in Hälsingb, to farmer N P Pehrsson and Alma Gudmundsson. He married Mai Areschoug. Pehrsson studied at Hbg in 1908 and graduated from KTH with a specialization in metallurgy and smelting art in 1912. He worked as an engineer at SKF in Gothenburg from 1913 to 1916, followed by a role as a laboratory technician at Atlas Verkstad in Stockholm from 1916 to 1917. Pehrsson then joined AB Atlas Diesels as a sales representative from 1918 to 1926. He later held positions such as Vice Managing Director at AB C E Johansson from 1926 to 1931 and Technical Director at Sandvikens Järnverks AB from 1931 to 1938. From 1938 onwards, he served as the Vice Managing Director and Technical Manager at Sandvikens Järnverks AB. Pehrsson was actively involved in various organizations and served on the boards of several companies. He was also a member of the Railway Board. Erik Gustaf Pehrsson received the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav and the Royal Swedish Order of Vasa.

career.occupational_title: Vice Managing Director and Technical Manager
